alert.note: Alert for Barry; McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 1:23AM CDT until June 18 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... Southwestern Barry County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 215 AM CDT. * At 121 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ketchum to near Jay to near Oaks, moving northeast at 70 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR MCDONALD AND SOUTHWESTERN BARRY COUNTIES! HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... South West City around 135 AM CDT. Noel around 140 AM CDT. Lanagan around 145 AM CDT. Anderson around 150 AM CDT. Pineville and Goodman around 155 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Big Sugar Creek State Park, Roaring River State Park, Dodge, Butterfield, Cayuga, Wayne, Powell, Tiff City, Rocky Comfort and Ridgley. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 14. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is an EXTREMELY DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across northeastern Oklahoma. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
